citeinfo.origin: National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: Hourly, Daily, Monthly, Seasonal, and Annual Upper-level Winds and Maritime Surface Weather for the Bering Sea Coast (1886-1938)

descript.abstract:
General meteorological conditions, winds, weather, and climate (pub.1942).
Call number: QC994.6.G4 1886-1938 archive.
Excerpt from: H.O. pub. no. 187, chapter 2.
Contains annual and monthly frequency distribution of cloud ceiling hours, mean relative humidity, snowfall, clear, cloudy, and partly cloudy hours; seasonal mean total cloud, haze, mist, upper-air wind, gales, and thunderstorm frequencies; monthly mean sea level pressure, sea surface temperatures for March and August, air temperatures for February and August, maximum gusts, wind direction frequencies, and mean typhoons and williwaws; seasonal, monthly, hourly, and days with fog frequencies; and annual, seasonal, daily, and days with precipitation frequencies. Includes data for stations at Dutch Harbor, Alaska; Kanaga Island, Alaska; St. Paul Island, Alaska; Mizusawa, Japan; Nikolski, Komandorski Islands; Petropavlovsk, Kamchatka Peninsula.
This publication is in the National Climatic Data Center's Foreign Data Library, and is one of many books, atlases, maps, charts and other printed materials received by the NCDC from many nations over the years.
descript.purpose: A report on the Hourly, Daily, Monthly, Seasonal, and Annual Upper-level Winds and Maritime Surface Weather for the Bering Sea Coast(1886-1938)
